text: hi my name is John watts and I'm the
director of spider-man homecoming so
this is a scene early in the film Peters
just had kind of a crummy night
crime-fighting he wasn't able to stop
the bad guys he got some bad news from
Tony Stark and to top it off he lost his
backpack that had his change of clothes
which forces him to sneak back into his
apartment where his Aunt May is so I
wasn't I wanted to do this scene as one
long take so that meant we had to build
the set with a hole in the ceiling that
we could rig Peter played by Tom Holland
to to track him as he as he climbed
along the ceiling and then we drop him
at the very end and the idea was to
build the tension as to whether or not
his Aunt May was going to hear him Peter
takes a deep breath we feel like the
scene is over and we revealed that his
friend Ned played by Jacob battle on has
been there watching him the whole time
the dropping of the Lego Death Star was
another very tense moment on set because
we only had four of those and they took
weeks to assemble so only after Tom's
climbing across the ceiling and dropping
down stunt was perfect what I yell drop
giving Jacob the cue to drop the Death
Star so it built a fun tension and
created a funny tableau that Aunt May
played by Marissa Tomei could step in
acknowledged and then leave
[Music]
Oh
